stk.molecular.topologies.cage.two_plus_three module¶

Defines cage topologies from 2 and 3 functionalized building blocks.

class stk.molecular.topologies.cage.two_plus_three.Dodecahedron(A_alignments=None, B_alignments=None, edge_alignments=None, bb_positions=None)¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.cage.base.CageTopology

A dodecahedron cage from 2 and 3 functionalized building blocks.

A = Vertex(2.43, 0.0, 0.927)¶
B = Vertex(-2.43, 0.0, 0.927)¶
C = Vertex(-2.43, 0.0, -0.927)¶
D = Vertex(2.43, 0.0, -0.927)¶
E = Vertex(0.927, 2.43, 0.0)¶
F = Vertex(0.927, -2.43, 0.0)¶
G = Vertex(-0.927, -2.43, 0.0)¶
H = Vertex(-0.927, 2.43, 0.0)¶
I = Vertex(0.0, 0.927, 2.43)¶
J = Vertex(0.0, 0.927, -2.43)¶
K = Vertex(0.0, -0.927, -2.43)¶
L = Vertex(0.0, -0.927, 2.43)¶
M = Vertex(1.5, 1.5, 1.5)¶
N = Vertex(1.5, -1.5, 1.5)¶
O = Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, 1.5)¶
P = Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, 1.5)¶
Q = Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, -1.5)¶
R = Vertex(1.5, 1.5, -1.5)¶
S = Vertex(1.5, -1.5, -1.5)¶
T = Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, -1.5)¶
_ = [Vertex(-0.927, 2.43, 0.0), Vertex(0.0, 0.927, 2.43), Vertex(0.0, 0.927, -2.43), Vertex(0.0, -0.927, -2.43), Vertex(0.0, -0.927, 2.43), Vertex(1.5, 1.5, 1.5), Vertex(1.5, -1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, -1.5), Vertex(1.5, 1.5, -1.5), Vertex(1.5, -1.5, -1.5), Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, -1.5)]¶
_bb_maps(macro_mol)¶

Creates a maps from position to building block.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule which needs to have its building blocks mapped to positions.
Returns:Each dict maps a position to the building block which sits on it. The position is refered to its index in positions_A or positions_B.
Return type:tuple of dict
bonded_fgs(macro_mol)¶

Joins up the separate building blocks which form the molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – The fg_ids of functional groups to be bonded.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
cleanup(macro_mol)¶

Performs final clean up actions on an assembled molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
n_window_types = 1¶
n_windows = 12¶
pair_fgs_with_positions(scale, macro_mol, vertex)¶

Matches fgs with the closest building block position.

After a building block is placed on a position, each fg which forms a bond must be paired with the location of the building block to which it bonds. This function matches fgs and positions so that each is only present in one pairing and so that the total distance of the pairings is minimized.

This updates of Vertex.fg_position_pairs attribute of vertex.

Parameters:
  • scale (float) – The amount by which the size of the topology is scaled.
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being buit.
  • vertex (Vertex) – The position at which all the atoms being paired are located.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
phi = 1.618033988749895¶
place_mols(macro_mol)¶

Places all building block molecules on correct coordinates.

The building block molecules are placed in their appropriate positions based on the topology. It does not join them.

Also updates MacroMolecule.bb_counter.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being built.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
positions_A = [Vertex(2.43, 0.0, 0.927), Vertex(-2.43, 0.0, 0.927), Vertex(-2.43, 0.0, -0.927), Vertex(2.43, 0.0, -0.927), Vertex(0.927, 2.43, 0.0), Vertex(0.927, -2.43, 0.0), Vertex(-0.927, -2.43, 0.0), Vertex(-0.927, 2.43, 0.0), Vertex(0.0, 0.927, 2.43), Vertex(0.0, 0.927, -2.43), Vertex(0.0, -0.927, -2.43), Vertex(0.0, -0.927, 2.43), Vertex(1.5, 1.5, 1.5), Vertex(1.5, -1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, 1.5), Vertex(-1.5, 1.5, -1.5), Vertex(1.5, 1.5, -1.5), Vertex(1.5, -1.5, -1.5), Vertex(-1.5, -1.5, -1.5)]¶

Performs ops between placing and reacting building blocks.

class stk.molecular.topologies.cage.two_plus_three.EightPlusTwelve(A_alignments=None, B_alignments=None, edge_alignments=None, bb_positions=None)¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.cage.base.CageTopology

A square topology from 2 and 3 functionalized building blocks.

_bb_maps(macro_mol)¶

Creates a maps from position to building block.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule which needs to have its building blocks mapped to positions.
Returns:Each dict maps a position to the building block which sits on it. The position is refered to its index in positions_A or positions_B.
Return type:tuple of dict
a¶
b¶
bonded_fgs(macro_mol)¶

Joins up the separate building blocks which form the molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – The fg_ids of functional groups to be bonded.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
c¶
cleanup(macro_mol)¶

Performs final clean up actions on an assembled molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
d¶
e¶
f¶
g¶
h¶
n_window_types = 1¶
n_windows = 6¶
pair_fgs_with_positions(scale, macro_mol, vertex)¶

Matches fgs with the closest building block position.

After a building block is placed on a position, each fg which forms a bond must be paired with the location of the building block to which it bonds. This function matches fgs and positions so that each is only present in one pairing and so that the total distance of the pairings is minimized.

This updates of Vertex.fg_position_pairs attribute of vertex.

Parameters:
  • scale (float) – The amount by which the size of the topology is scaled.
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being buit.
  • vertex (Vertex) – The position at which all the atoms being paired are located.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
place_mols(macro_mol)¶

Places all building block molecules on correct coordinates.

The building block molecules are placed in their appropriate positions based on the topology. It does not join them.

Also updates MacroMolecule.bb_counter.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being built.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
positions_A¶
positions_B¶
prepare(macro_mol)¶

Performs ops between placing and reacting building blocks.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
class stk.molecular.topologies.cage.two_plus_three.FourPlusSix(A_alignments=None, B_alignments=None, edge_alignments=None, bb_positions=None)¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.cage.base.CageTopology

Defines the tetrahedral, 4+6, topology.

This is a topology of cages where 4 building blocks are placed on vertices and 6 linkers are placed on the edges between them.

_bb_maps(macro_mol)¶

Creates a maps from position to building block.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule which needs to have its building blocks mapped to positions.
Returns:Each dict maps a position to the building block which sits on it. The position is refered to its index in positions_A or positions_B.
Return type:tuple of dict

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – The fg_ids of functional groups to be bonded.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

pair_fgs_with_positions(scale, macro_mol, vertex)¶

Matches fgs with the closest building block position.

After a building block is placed on a position, each fg which forms a bond must be paired with the location of the building block to which it bonds. This function matches fgs and positions so that each is only present in one pairing and so that the total distance of the pairings is minimized.

This updates of Vertex.fg_position_pairs attribute of vertex.

  • vertex (Vertex) – The position at which all the atoms being paired are located.
